data.title: Here are 12 free concert series taking place around Louisville this summer
data.meta_description: Pack your blankets and lawn chairs, grab some friends and listen to some of your favorite performers, with everything from country to R&B.
data.text:
Summer in Louisville means it's time for free concerts. From country to R&B, rock, and more, there's something for everyone to enjoy at a dozen concert series held across Louisville and southern Indiana from now until late August (and beyond!)

Be sure to pack your blankets and lawn chairs, bring some friends, and listen and dance to some of your favorite performers, all for free.

Kick a season of free music off this Wednesday, May 29 at WFPK's Waterfront Wednesday at Waterfront Park, featuring Pokey LaFarge, S.G. Goodman, and the Ellie Ruth Band.

Here's your guide to free outdoor concerts around the Louisville area this summer.

Bicentennial Park Summer Concert Series

Bicentennial Park at the corner of Spring and Pearl streets (118 E. Spring St.), New Albany from 6:30-9:30 p.m. on Fridays. Bring lawn chairs and blankets. newalbanycityhall.com/bicentennialpark.

May 31: Paul McDonald & the Mourning Doves, Joslyn & the Sweet Compression

June 7: Nick Dittmeier & the Sawdusters, The Ian Abel Trio

June 14: The Jesse Lees, Scott T. Smith

June 21: Tommy Womack, Club House Troubadours

June 28: Jameron, Rockstead

July 12: Bibelhauser, Arianna & the Bourbon Britches

July 19: Kiana & the Sunkings, Bandits on the Run

July 26: Dave Meland Band, The Skinny

Colonial Gardens Summer in the Gardens

On the patio, 818 W. Kenwood Drive, 6-9 p.m. Food and drinks are available for purchase. colonialgardenslouky.com

May 31: The Last Band Standing

June 6: Jeremy Scharfe

June 7: Jonathan Paxton

June 13: Dusty Bo

June 14: The Checkmates

June 20: Lampus

June 21: Bluegrass Jam

June 27: Ethan & Joey

July 12: Jonathan Paxton

July 18: Bluegrass Jam

July 25: Ethan & Joey

July 26: R & R 3

FridayFest Concert Series

Highview Park, 7201 Outer Loop (enter through Briscoe Lane), 6-10 p.m. Fridays. Also children’s activities, food trucks with a variety of food options. Bring lawn chairs or blankets. facebook.com/FridayFestHP/about.

May 31: J.D. Shelburne, School of Rock Louisville

June 14: The Brass Pack, PoJo

June 28: Radiotronic, BeeGees Tribute

July 12: The Sheryl Rouse Band, Jordan Wilson Coalition

July 26: An Evening with The Monarchs

Aug. 9: DaveMeland Band, Jack n’ Lindsey

Whiskey Wednesdays

3rd Turn Oldham Gardens, 6300 Old La Grange Road, Crestwood, 6-9 p.m. Wednesdays. Enjoy signature cocktails and beer from 3rd Turn Brewing and food from the Backside Grill. Bring lawn chairs and blankets. touroldham.com.

June 5: R & R 3

June 12: Mark Conover

June 19: Allen Lane

June 16: Andrew Lee

Concerts in Warder Park

Sonny Brewster Bandstand, 109 E. Court Ave., Jeffersonville, 7 p.m. Fridays. Bring lawn chairs and blankets. Presented by Jeffersonville Main Street and the Jeffersonville Parks Department. jeffmainstreet.org.

June 7: Derby City Brass Band

June 14: Cloigheann Irish Band

June 21: Polkatz

June 28: River Cities Concert Band

July 12: Jamey Aebersold Quartet

July 19: The Don Krekel Orchestra

July 26: Joyful Noise

Aug. 2: Moonlight Big Band

Aug. 9: Kosair Dance Band

Aug. 16: Take Two

Aug. 23: The Clark Band

Aug. 30: Moon Dogs

Jammin in Jeff Concert Series

Jeffersonville RiverStage, 100 W. Riverside Drive, Jeffersonville, Indiana, 7 p.m. Fridays. Food trucks, beer garden and cocktails. Chairs, blankets and small coolers are allowed. Pets, smoking and alcohol are not permitted. Sponsored by Shoe Sensation. jeffparks.org/jeffriverstage/.

June 7: Juicebox Heroes, Wax Factory

June 15: Juneteenth Celebration

June 21: Summer Beach party with Sounds of Summer, The Get Down

June 28: Big Easy on the Ohio

July 5: Princess Purple Party with The Sheryl Rouse Band, The Jesse Lee’s

July 12: Nashtucky Country Night with J.D. Shelburne, India Ramey

July 19: Pink Floyd Tribute & Light Show with Echoes of Pompeii, Producing a Kind Generation

July 26: Thunderstruck, Matt Red Moore

Aug. 2: Reverend Peyton’s Big Damn Band, Joslyn and the Sweet Compressions

Aug. 9: Hot Brown Smackdown, Kindred Valley

Aug. 16: The Jayhawks

Trackside Tunes

Alley Loop, corner of Walnut Avenue and Poplar Alley, La Grange, 7-9 p.m. Fridays. Food trucks, beer, and cocktails will be available for purchase at 6 p.m. Bring lawn chairs. touroldham.com.

June 7: Doorway

July 5: Bourbon & Brass

Aug. 2: Ladies for Liberty

Sept. 6: Allen Lane Band

Oct. 4: The Bottle Trees

Dan-O' Sizzling Summer Series

3rd Turn Oldham Gardens, 6300 Old La Grange Road, Crestwood, 6-9 p.m. Fridays. Enjoy signature cocktails and beer from 3rd Turn Brewing, as well as food from the Backside Grill. touroldham.com.

June 8: The Aesthetic

Good Times Summer Concert Series Clarksville

Central Green, outside Bolt+Tie complex, 1400 Main St., Clarksville, Indiana, 6-11 p.m. Saturdays. Food trucks, beer garden by Ten20 Craft Brewery. Sponsored in part by the Cornerstone Group. townofclarksville.com/goodtimes.

June 8: From Paris, The Echoes

July 13: The Mad Taxpayers, The Atomic Groove Machine

Aug. 17: The Les Master’s Band, The Swerve

Copper & Kings Sonic Sundays

Copper & Kings Courtyard, 1121 E. Washington St., doors open at 3 p.m.; show starts at 3:30 p.m. on Sundays. Food from the courtyard kitchen, Copper & Kings cocktails, yard games, and small bites. copperandkings.com

June 9: The Bibelhauser Brothers

July 14: Jameron

Aug. 11: TBA

Sept. 8: Scott T. Smith

Oct 13: TBA

Old Louisville Live

Treyton Oak Towers, 211 W. Oak St., 7 p.m. Presented by the Old Louisville Neighborhood Council. oldlouisville.org/old-louisville-live.

June 22: The Hora Certa Brazilian Jazz Ensemble

WFPK Waterfront Wednesdays

This is the 22nd season of WFPK Waterfront Wednesday, held at Waterfront Park, next to the Big Four Pedestrian Bridge, on Wednesdays. Gates open at the rain or shine event at 5 p.m. and music begins at 6 p.m. Alcohol, coolers, glass, and pets are not allowed. Proceeds from WFPK Waterfront Wednesday benefit Louisville Public Media and Waterfront Park. Children and families can enjoy the Waterfront Kids Day, a dedicated area for kids and families to participate in hands-on activities (5-8 p.m.). LPM.org/WaterfrontWednesday

June 26: Middle Kids, Relaay (formerly Bridge 19)

July 31: Modern English, Snacktime, Digby

Aug. 28: Matthew Sweet, Friko, Nise the Nymph

Sept. 25: Dark Side of the Wall, Zaniah, Flow

Did we miss an event? Send a note to Features News Clerk Gege Reed at greed@courier-journal.com.
